summary: This document is an email chain from October 14, 2020, between a journalist and a U.S. Attorney's Office public information officer. The journalist is seeking clarification on a court hearing regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal and a judge's denial of the SDNY's access to a civil case file in which Maxwell was deposed.

persons.name: Stephen Brown
persons.context: A reporter for the NY Daily News covering Manhattan Federal Court, who is writing a story about a hearing on Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal and is seeking information from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jim Margolin
persons.context: The Chief Public Information Officer for the U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, to whom Stephen Brown's inquiry is forwarded.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the appeal hearing and the civil case in question; she was deposed in the referenced case.

persons.name: Judge Koetl
persons.context: The judge on "Court 2" who denied the SDNY access to a civil case file related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Journalist seeking information and clarification from a public information officer at the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Judge Koetl issued a ruling denying SDNY access to a civil case file involving Maxwell, which the journalist suggests was a fortunate break for Maxwell.

events.title: Maxwell Appeal Hearing
events.description: A hearing before the 2nd Circuit regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal.

events.title: Judge Koetl's Ruling on Case File Access
events.description: Judge Koetl denied the SDNY access to a civil case file in which Ghislaine Maxwell was deposed.

keyFacts: A hearing on Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal took place before the 2nd Circuit on October 13, 2020.
Judge Koetl denied the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY access to a civil case file related to Maxwell.
Ghislaine Maxwell was deposed in the civil case that was the subject of the access denial.
A journalist characterized Judge Koetl's ruling as a 'fortunate break' for Maxwell.
